comments.creator: ilhan@ilhan.name
comments.text:
Created attachment 566592
typing.PNG

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I was typing in a text field.


Actual results:

It jumped to the next text area.


Expected results:

It shouldn't jump to the next text area.
comments.author: ilhan@ilhan.name

comments.text: It was during the page load.

comments.creator: simona.marcu@softvision.com
comments.author: simona.marcu@softvision.com
comments.text:
I could not reproduce this issue on:

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:10.0a1) Gecko/20111027 Firefox/10.0a1

Reporter, please can you confirm whether this issue is still reproducible when you start Firefox in safe mode or with a clean profile?http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+Mode http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
comments.raw_text:

comments.author: ilhan@ilhan.name
comments.creator: ilhan@ilhan.name
comments.text:
It is hard to reproduce. But it is not rare. Combination of of slow internet connection, slow page rendering (due to big page size too much amount of elements) will help to reproduce this. By the way, it very old bug and I come on the same bug on other browsers. Could it be because of the operating system?
(I'll try to reproduce it within few days.)
comments.raw_text:
It is hard to reproduce. But it is not rare. Combination of of slow internet connection, slow page rendering (due to big page size too much amount of elements) will help to reproduce this. By the way, it very old bug and I come on the same bug on other browsers. Could it be because of the operating system?
(I'll try to reproduce it within few days.)

comments.text:
If it's seen in other browsers it's unlikely not a Firefox problem.

Are you using a laptop with a touch pad? Could you be brushing the pad while typing? I've seen that cause jumps or other unintentional activity.
comments.raw_text:
If it's seen in other browsers it's unlikely not a Firefox problem.

Are you using a laptop with a touch pad? Could you be brushing the pad while typing? I've seen that cause jumps or other unintentional activity.
comments.author: bj@herbison.com
comments.creator: bj@herbison.com

comments.text: Nope. This one was on a regular desktop PC. And the bug is very old. I've seen it also while a friend was typing, it goes to the other field, like a magic. It happens while the page is rendering.
comments.raw_text: Nope. This one was on a regular desktop PC. And the bug is very old. I've seen it also while a friend was typing, it goes to the other field, like a magic. It happens while the page is rendering.
